solution_line_template: The first shirt has no ({first_shirt_discount_percent_text}%) discount off the regular price (${regular_price_per_shirt}), therefore your discount is = {first_shirt_discount_percent_text}% * ${regular_price_per_shirt} = $<<{first_shirt_discount_percent_text}*{percent_factor}*{regular_price_per_shirt}={first_shirt_discount_amount}>>{first_shirt_discount_amount}

The second shirt has a {second_shirt_discount_percent_text}% discount off the regular price (${regular_price_per_shirt}), therefore your discount is = {second_shirt_discount_percent_text}% * ${regular_price_per_shirt} = $<<{second_shirt_discount_percent_text}*{percent_factor}*{regular_price_per_shirt}={second_shirt_discount_amount}>>{second_shirt_discount_amount}

The third shirt has a {third_shirt_discount_percent_text}% discount of the regular price (${regular_price_per_shirt}), therefore your discount is = {third_shirt_discount_percent_text}% * ${regular_price_per_shirt} = $<<{third_shirt_discount_percent_text}*{percent_factor}*{regular_price_per_shirt}={third_shirt_discount_amount}>>{third_shirt_discount_amount}

Therefore in total, you save ${first_shirt_discount_amount} on the first shirt, ${second_shirt_discount_amount} on the second one and ${third_shirt_discount_amount} on the third one = {first_shirt_discount_amount}+{second_shirt_discount_amount}+{third_shirt_discount_amount} = $<<{first_shirt_discount_amount}+{second_shirt_discount_amount}+{third_shirt_discount_amount}={total_savings}>>{total_savings}
